etymology.description: phonetic 丣(丣) (yǒu, undefined) + semantic 田(田) (tián, "field") -> field-related meaning -> evolved to include notion of staying or remaining
etymology.interpretation: The character 畱 combines 田(田) (tián, "field") for the semantic field and 丣(丣) (yǒu) for phonetic properties. Fields can symbolize locations where something is held or remains, contributing to the sense of 'stay.'

examples.chinese: 我打算畱一天(我打算畱一天)。
examples.english: I plan to stay for one day.

examples.chinese: 她决定畱在旧城(她決定畱在舊城)，与朋友谈心(與朋友談心)。
examples.pinyin: Tā juédìng liú zài jiùchéng, yǔ péngyǒu tánxīn.
examples.english: She decided to stay in the old city and chat with her friends.

examples.chinese: 夜深人静(夜深人靜)，我拟畱此所安眠(我擬畱此所安眠)。
examples.pinyin: Yè shēn rénjìng, wǒ nǐ liú cǐ suǒ ānmián.
examples.english: When the night is quiet, I intend to stay here and sleep peacefully.
